channel.title: deprecated on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in deprecated on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Accessing Encrypted Credentials from Google Chrome Login Database
item.description: Adversaries may acquire credentials from web browsers by reading files specific to the target browser. Web browsers commonly save credentials such as website usernames and passwords so that they do not need to be entered manually in the future. Web browsers typically store the credentials in an encrypted format within a credential store.

item.title: Rclone Execution via Command Line or PowerShell
item.description: Detects Rclone which is commonly used by ransomware groups for exfiltration

item.title: RClone Execution
item.description: Detects execution of RClone utility for exfiltration as used by various ransomwares strains like REvil, Conti, FiveHands, etc

item.title: Windows Management Instrumentation DLL Loaded Via Microsoft Word
item.description: Detects DLL’s Loaded Via Word Containing VBA Macros Executing WMI Commands

item.title: Activity Related to NTDS.dit Domain Hash Retrieval
item.description: Detects suspicious commands that could be related to activity that uses volume shadow copy to steal and retrieve hashes from the NTDS.dit file remotely

item.title: Lateral Movement Indicator ConDrv
item.description: This event was observed on the target host during lateral movement. The process name within the event contains the process spawned post compromise. Account Name within the event contains the compromised user account name. This event should to be correlated with 4624 and 4688 for further intrusion context.

item.title: Mimikatz Detection LSASS Access
item.description: Detects process access to LSASS which is typical for Mimikatz (0x1000 PROCESS_QUERY_ LIMITED_INFORMATION, 0x0400 PROCESS_QUERY_ INFORMATION “only old versions”, 0x0010 PROCESS_VM_READ)

item.title: Suspicious Esentutl Use
item.description: Detects flags often used with the LOLBAS Esentutl for malicious activity. It could be used in rare cases by administrators to access locked files or during maintenance.

item.title: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execution to Bypass Powershell Restriction
item.description: Detects SyncAppvPublishingServer process execution which usually utilized by adversaries to bypass PowerShell execution restrictions.
